home.badge: The talent exchange built for community health
home.heroTitle: Find Your Next FQHC Role in {days} Days
home.heroSubtitle: We connect mission-driven healthcare professionals with California's Federally Qualified Health Centers — faster, smarter, and with the cultural fit that matters.
home.why1Description: We exclusively serve Federally Qualified Health Centers. Every candidate understands the mission, the populations, and the programs.
home.why2Description: Bilingual? ECM-certified? Experienced with OCHIN Epic? We match on the skills and cultural competencies that matter most to FQHCs.
home.why3Description: Our curated network means faster introductions — 5 days to first intro, 21 days average placement. No more months-long searches.
home.step1Description: Tell us about your experience, certifications, language skills, and what you're looking for.
home.step2Description: Our team reviews your profile and connects you with FQHCs that match your skills and preferences.
home.step3Description: Interview with confidence — we prepare you and support you through the entire process.
home.rolesSubtitle: From frontline community health workers to medical directors, we specialize in the roles that power California's FQHCs.
home.testimonialsSubtitle: Hear from community health professionals who found their next role through the FQHC network.
home.testimonial1Quote: After my clinic lost ECM funding, I thought my career as a care coordinator was over. Within two weeks, I was interviewing at three FQHCs that needed exactly my skill set.
home.testimonial2Quote: I spent months on generic job boards. Nobody understood what OCHIN Epic experience meant or why being bilingual mattered. This platform actually gets FQHC hiring.
home.testimonial3Quote: As an HR director, I was tired of sorting through hundreds of unqualified resumes. Now I get candidates who already understand our programs and patient populations.
home.featuredSubtitle: Browse profiles, salary data, and open positions at health centers across the state.
home.newsletterSubtitle: Get the latest FQHC job openings, salary insights, and career tips delivered to your inbox.
home.newsletterDisclaimer: We respect your privacy. Unsubscribe anytime.

pricing.title: Simple, Transparent Pricing
pricing.subtitle: No hidden fees. Pay only when you find the right hire.
pricing.tier1Desc: Explore the platform and see candidate profiles risk-free.
pricing.tier2Desc: For smaller FQHCs filling a handful of critical roles each quarter.
pricing.tier3Desc: Our most popular plan — built for FQHCs with ongoing hiring needs.
pricing.tier4Desc: Tailored solutions for multi-site FQHCs and health center networks.
pricing.placementFeesSubtitle: On top of your subscription, a placement fee applies only when you successfully hire a candidate through our platform.
pricing.fee15Desc: One-time fee charged only when a placed candidate starts work. Nothing upfront — ever.
pricing.retentionDesc: Candidates placed through us receive a retention bonus, incentivizing long-term commitment to your center.
pricing.guaranteeDesc: If a hire doesn't work out within 90 days, we source replacements at no extra placement cost.
pricing.faq1Q: How does the 14-day free trial work?
pricing.faq1A: Sign up and immediately access anonymized candidate profiles and post up to 2 openings. No credit card required. At the end of 14 days, choose a paid plan or your account pauses — no surprise charges.
pricing.faq2Q: What is the success-based placement fee?
pricing.faq2A: When you hire a candidate sourced through FQHC Talent Exchange, a one-time fee of 15% of the candidate's first-year salary applies. This is only charged upon a successful hire — you never pay if you don't hire.
pricing.faq3Q: What does the 90-day replacement guarantee cover?
pricing.faq3A: If a placed candidate leaves within the first 90 days for any reason, we'll source and present replacement candidates at no additional placement fee. Your subscription continues as normal.
pricing.faq4Q: Can I switch plans at any time?
pricing.faq4A: Yes. Upgrade or downgrade at any time from your dashboard. Changes take effect at the start of your next billing cycle, and we'll prorate any differences.
pricing.faq5Q: Do you integrate with our existing ATS or HRIS?
pricing.faq5A: Enterprise plans include API integrations with popular systems like Greenhouse, Lever, BambooHR, and others. Reach out and we'll confirm compatibility with your stack.
pricing.faq6A: No. All plans are month-to-month with no long-term commitment. Enterprise clients may opt for annual billing at a discounted rate.
pricing.ctaSubtitle: Join dozens of FQHCs finding mission-driven talent faster. Start your free trial today — no credit card required.

about.title: About FQHC Talent Exchange
about.subtitle: We're on a mission to strengthen California's community health workforce.
about.heroTitle: We Exist Because Community Health Workers Deserve Better
about.heroSubtitle: When California's Medi-Cal funding cuts displaced thousands of community health workers, we saw an industry failing the very people who hold it together. FQHC Talent Exchange was built to fix that.
about.problemP1: Federally Qualified Health Centers are the backbone of California's safety-net healthcare system. They serve over 7 million patients — most of them uninsured or on Medi-Cal — across more than 1,400 sites statewide. The people who make these clinics work are community health workers, care coordinators, patient navigators, and outreach specialists who share the language, culture, and lived experience of the communities they serve.
about.problemP2: When Medi-Cal funding cuts hit, these workers were the first to go. Not because they weren't essential — but because the programs that funded their positions lost revenue overnight. Meanwhile, other FQHCs across the state are desperately hiring for the exact same roles. The disconnect is staggering: experienced community health workers sitting at home while clinics down the road can't find qualified candidates.
about.problemP3: Generic job boards don't solve this. They don't understand FQHC-specific programs like Enhanced Care Management or Community Supports. They don't know that experience with OCHIN Epic is more relevant than experience with Cerner. They don't speak Spanish. And they certainly don't advocate for candidates — they just list jobs and move on.
about.approach1Desc: Every candidate gets a dedicated advocate who understands their experience, translates their skills into FQHC language, and actively introduces them to hiring organizations. We don't post and pray — we place people.
about.approach2Desc: Displaced workers can't wait months. Our process delivers first employer introductions within 5 days and targets full placement within 21 days. Every day a qualified worker sits idle is a day patients go underserved.
about.approach3Desc: We understand 330 grants, PPS billing, UDS reporting, and the alphabet soup of revenue-generating programs — ECM, CCM, Community Supports, TCM, BH-ASO. When we match candidates, we match on the competencies that actually matter to FQHCs.
about.approach4Desc: Community health workers should never have to pay to find their next role. Our platform is 100% free for candidates — always. Employers invest in our services because we save them time, money, and the cost of unfilled positions.
about.serveP1: Our platform serves the community health workforce across California — from community health workers and promotoras to care coordinators, behavioral health specialists, EHR analysts, and clinic leadership. Many of our candidates are bilingual Spanish-English professionals with deep roots in the communities their FQHCs serve.
about.serveP2: On the employer side, we work exclusively with Federally Qualified Health Centers and FQHC Look-Alikes. We understand the unique operational realities of community health — from managing multiple funding streams to maintaining UDS benchmarks — because that's all we do.
about.mattersP1: When a community health worker gets placed at an FQHC, it's not just a hire — it's a patient who gets connected to Medi-Cal, a family that finds a medical home, a chronic condition that gets managed before it becomes an emergency room visit. Every placement we make has a direct impact on health equity in California's most underserved communities.
about.mattersP2: We measure success by placement speed and community impact — not by how many resumes we collect or how much we can charge. If a candidate is better served by a direct referral than our full process, we make that referral. The mission comes first.
about.founderP1: FQHC Talent Exchange was founded by someone who saw the gap firsthand — experienced community health workers losing their positions to funding cuts while nearby clinics couldn't fill the same roles. We built this platform because the community health workforce deserves a hiring system that's as mission-driven as they are.
about.ctaSubtitle: Whether you're a displaced health worker looking for your next role or an FQHC with positions to fill, we're here to help.
